page.title: 13Housing
page.content: With the exception of the large farm houses - Cunnells, Coleshall, - and the large houses in Bobbing, most of the property in the area has been built since the first world war. In Iwade, Kemsley and Grovehurst it is not difficult to assess the age of the houses by observation, and it can be seen that the more modern houses are built to a much greater density. The village of Kemsley was established by the mill owners for their workers, but the houses were bought by the Borough Council, who built many more in this area. The houses in each of the areas are basically well kept, and gardening as a hobby is popular. Most of the houses built before 1955 have no garage and this causes parking problems on the roads
